meanings.sent1: She had a dubious expression on her face when asked about the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The student gave a dubious look before attempting the difficult math problem.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a dubious meow as if questioning the new toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a dubious creak in the night, making the residents uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds cast a dubious shadow over the picnic, hinting at rain.

meanings.sent1: The dubious website promised unbelievable discounts on designer bags.
meanings.sent2: His dubious alibi raised suspicions among the detectives.
meanings.sent3: The magician's dubious trick left the audience scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The dubious smell coming from the kitchen made everyone lose their appetite.
meanings.sent5: The dubious character in the movie turned out to be the villain all along.

meanings.definition: not to be relied upon; suspect
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast seemed dubious, predicting both rain and sunshine.
meanings.sent2: The dubious bridge had a sign warning drivers of its unstable condition.
meanings.sent3: The dubious map led the hikers in circles, causing frustration.
meanings.sent4: The dubious promise of quick wealth lured many unsuspecting individuals.
meanings.sent5: The dubious plan to fix the leaky roof involved using duct tape and hope.
